channel.title: Projects on Justus
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Justus

item.title: Simple dictionary bruteforce attack
item.description: Ok so this is how I made a dictionary based brute force attack First i needed to find the targets ip-address. In this example its a simple server on my lan next I opened kali linux on virtual box and scanned what ports are open on the server by typing in this command nmap 192.168.1.116 after that I can see that ports 22 and 80 are open. Commonly 22 is used for remote access and 80 is used for http traffic after knowing this I can try bruteforcing ssh access In this case because I dont want to wait forever I have created a simpler list of passwords that might be the correct one.

item.title: Host multible websites on linux
item.description: To better follow this you should first read this Ok… First make sure youre in the correct place: cd /var/www/html in this example I’m going to host just two sites but you can host as many as you want… In this example i want to have one site in domain ju5tu5.net and another at test.ju5tu5.net So to host two sites make a folder for each different site you want to make like in the picture: then place your website files in each of these folder

item.title: Host a website on linux
item.description: go to the directory on your computer where your hugo site files are located. Cmd on that directory and use the command: hugo -D get you public folder and its files to github Use PUTTY to access your server by typing in the ip address of your server. Next run these commands to make sure that the software is uptodate: sudo apt update sudo apt upgrade Next install apache2, git and PHP by running these commands sudo apt install apache2 -y sudo apt install git -y sudo apt install php -y After this you can go to your server ip address on your browser and you should see this: Now navigate to the correct directory by using this command:

item.title: Movies watched
item.description: As a guy who loves to watch different movies and tv shows I created this static website do display the movies that i have watched over the years. The website shows basic stats like the movie name, release date and a poster image. I also added to show the rating of what i though about that specific movie. This data is received using the TMDB (the movie database) apikey. My watched movies

item.title: Christmas preparations
item.description: I created a simple website with some cool tools to help manage christmas To the website

item.title: Iron Man: arc reactor
item.description: I’m a very big Marvel fan myself. My favorites are doctor strange and Iron Man. One day I watched a youtube video and it showed how to build Iron man’s arc reactor using a 3d printer. I downloaded the file and immediately got excited about the project. To original video! In the first step, I actually started by printing the body of the arc reactor. Next I had to get an EL panel for my project.
